Unfortunately, Jordan’s King Hussein, ruler of the West Bank, was the sole Arab leader seeking a path of moderation with the Jewish State. For nearly three years the King had been meeting secretly with Golda Meir, the Israeli Foreign Minister, in an effort to forestall another war in the region and to find some path to peace. US President Johnson had helped facilitate these meetings, and supported King Hussein with these initiatives. The Israeli strike at Samu’ was fraught with peril, both militarily and politically. Can you do better?

Each copy of Shredding Peace is composed of the following:

Two 11 by 17 inch hex map sheets with game charts and tables.
91 un-mounted, double-sided counters
8 pages of rules

Infantry (Airborne, Headquarter) and Heavy Weapons are all Companies of about 100 to 120 men. Tank and the armored car units represent 2 vehicles, and each halftrack represents 4 vehicles. A hex on the map is about three quarters of a mile across. Each turn represents one half hour of time. The game uses a standard deck of playing cards and a ten sided die for play.

Shredding Peace is designed by Paul Rohrbaugh and features graphics by Dariusz Buraczewski.
Families: Series: Standard Deck Activation System (High Flying Dice Games)

Name: Vault of Dragons: Blessing of the Gods – Cleric Expansion Set
Description: Vault of Dragons: Blessing of the Gods – Cleric Expansion Set adds clerics, blessing tokens, and five new dungeon/location titles to the game. Each player receives a male and female cleric, as well as a d8 in their faction color.

Name: On Mars: Alien Invasion
Description:
On Mars: Alien Invasion is the much-anticipated Somewhat Cooperative Expansion to Vital Lacerda’s best-selling and highly-rated On Mars base game. Though this expansion was originally going to be named Surviving Mars, Eagle-Gryphon Games made the decision to change the name to On Mars: Alien Invasion to better reflect the theme and content of this expansion. The game narrative is contained in four chapters of a story written by Nathan Morse. Gameplay contains four new and different ways to expand upon and play the base game. You will play one versus many; completely cooperatively; and even solo if you wish, depending on the chapter. Included are four fresh and completely replayable ways to establish colonies On Mars!

For instance, here is the narrative that opens the first chapter and sets the stage for all of the following action:

Alert! Sensors indicate that aliens are invading the famous red planet! Long have the conspiracy theorists predicted this. The threat to your mission is too great; you must take action. Will you be able to prevent the infectious spread of these beings bent on expanding to every habitable planet in the galaxy? Or will you play for the other side, a species trying to establish a colony on Mars, blithely oblivious to the danger their expansion represents, unaware that there are others out there eager to keep humans “where they belong” on Earth. 
 —description from the publisher

On Mars: Alien Invasion is a short story expansion to On Mars made in 4 chapters with 4 different modes of play.

The short story is called Alien Invasion and contemplates the following Chapters and modes of play:

Chapter 1 - Invasion - 1 vs All - 3 to 5 players
Chapter 2 - Outbreak - Co-Op - 2 to 4 players
Chapter 3 - Blackout - Co-Op - 2 to 4 players
Chapter 4 - Monolith - Solo - 1 player

—description from the designer

Name: The Battle of Guandu
Description:
Issue game in Command Magazine Japan #146

The Battle of Guandu was fought between the warlords Cao Cao and Yuan Shao in 200 AD in the late Eastern Han dynasty. Cao Cao's decisive victory against Yuan Shao's numerically superior forces marked the turning point in their war. The victory was also the point at which Cao Cao became the dominant power in northern China, leading to its eventual unification and the establishment of the state of Cao Wei in the Three Kingdoms period.

Name: L.O.L. Surprise: Surprise Makeover
Description:
Players try to collect the five unique accessory items to complete their fabulous makeover. Players flips two cards from the deck and try to find matching accessories. If they match one of the five IRL accessories the collect that item. If it's not one of the IRL accessories they collect the card set. Once they have three card sets they can turn that it for any IRL accessory they wish. But there is one last surprise! One some cards all the accessories match. If you catch it and yell, "Jackpot!" you get to choose whichever IRL accessory you need. First player to collect all five IRL accessories is the winner.

-description from designer

Name: L.O.L. Surprise: 7 Surprises Card Game
Description:
Players set out to collect all seven items that make up the four unique L.O.L. Surprise! dolls. Each player starts with five cards and on their turn draw two cards. On their turn they can play up to three cards by creating sets of the unique L.O.L. Surprise! dolls or play action cards like Go Shopping!, which allows the players to draw 2 additional cards from the pile. Additionally players can try to make a set of seven Secret Message cards, and upon succeeding they can discard the set to search the draw pile for any card they need. First player to complete one doll set of seven cards is the winner!

-description from designer

Name: Enter the Dungeons of Brochuria
Description:
A single player dungeon exploring adventure contained in a single pamphlet.  All you need is a pen.

—description from the introduction

Enter the Dungeons of Brochuria was developed as an entry into the Pamphlet Dungeon Jam contest.  The game is presented as a six-pane, tri-fold, print-and-play brochure.

The solitaire player uses tokens and the board to move their "character" through a dungeon one square at a time, with the count determined by die roll.  Squares have various icons representing hazards or encounters which must be handled by the character; or treasure which can be gathered.

The player loses if their character runs out of health and wins if they defeat the final boss.

—user summary

Name: Escape from Castle Iggur
Description:
A Single Player Survival Game

—description from the introduction

Escape from Castle Iggur was developed as an entry into the Pamphlet Dungeon Jam contest.  The game is presented as a six-pane, tri-fold, print-and-play brochure.

The solitaire player moves up through a seven-level dungeon, from the lowest level to the top level, facing a challenge or gaining a reward on each level.  Each challenge presents a numeric rating that must be beaten by a modified die roll.  Each reward provides a bonus to subsequent die rolls.  Points are gained for each challenge defeated.

The player loses when they fail to beat a challenge, or wins when they escape the dungeon.  Game points may be compared to other game plays to determine relative success.

—user summary

Name: Fading Light
Description:
Fly between stars; Peer into the history of worlds; Collect artifacts; Influence cultural evolution; Mine singularities; Run out of gas; Get caught within an event horizon

Fading Light:

Enter the Dungeons of Brochuria was developed as an entry into the Pamphlet Dungeon Jam contest.  The game is presented as a six-pane, tri-fold, print-and-play brochure.

The game primarily is designed for a single player (additional players essentially run a parallel game).  Play involves rolling Fudge Dice and consulting action tables to determine turn resolution.  The player controls an in game currency ("cultural artifacts") and resource ("gigasecond").  Play proceeds until the player runs out of either (a loss) or holds a specified amount of either (a win).

—description from the introduction

Name: Fashion Show
Description:
Take on the designer and prepare best outfits that will become a hit at the upcoming Fashion Show! Decide where you will be looking for inspiration - in the burnt reds of the Spanish style, oriental Japanese motifs, or maybe you bet on French simplicity, chic and elegance? To win you will need: a large dose of creativity, amazing ideas, knowledge of fashion trends and a sense of style.
The show is getting closer and the big machine has started - you need to do shopping, order designs and complete the entire collection! The designer will win, who will do everything on time!
Fashion Show is a competitive card game for the whole family.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Wciel siÄ™ w projektanta i przygotuj niezwykÅ‚e stroje, które stanÄ… siÄ™ hitem na nadchodzÄ…cym pokazie Fashion Show! Zdecyduj, gdzie bÄ™dziesz szukaÅ‚ inspiracji – w spalonych czerwieniach stylu hiszpaÅ„skiego, orientalnych motywach japoÅ„skich, a moÅ¼e postawisz na francuskÄ… prostotÄ™, szyk i elegancjÄ™? Do zwyciÄ™stwa potrzebne bÄ™dÄ…: duÅ¼a dawka kreatywnoÅ›ci, niesamowite pomysÅ‚y, znajomoÅ›Ä‡ modowych trendów i wyczucie stylu. 
Pokaz coraz bliÅ¼ej, wielka machina ruszyÅ‚a – trzeba zrobiÄ‡ zakupy, zamówiÄ‡ projekty i skompletowaÄ‡ caÅ‚Ä… kolekcjÄ™! Wygra ten projektant, który ze wszystkim zdÄ…Å¼y na czas!
„Fashion Show” to rywalizacyjna gra karciana dla caÅ‚ej rodziny.

—description from the publisher

Name: Take Root
Description:
Congratulations! You all have achieved the dream, you have a farm.  The world is nothing but possibility, at least for this next year.

The game takes place over 4 seasons: spring, summer, fall, and winter, with each season having 9 days.

—description from the introduction

Take Root was developed as an entry into the Pamphlet Dungeon Jam contest.  The game is presented as a six-pane, tri-fold, print-and-play brochure.

The game is played over four turns with each turn containing nine phases.  Players may choose and activity for each phase with an outcome determined by die roll.  During play, players accumulate an in-game currency (coins) and resources (seeds and harvested vegetables).  Points accumulate through play.  At the end of the game, each player puts together a "festival display" of harvested vegetables and the winning display scores points.  A few other end-of-game categories also score points.  The player with the most accumulated points is the winner.

—user summary

Name: Help! I'm a Tetra Block!
Description:
Wiggling in place, you tried to roll off the bed as usual, but nothing happened.

There is no bed.

There is no "you".

The vast greyness up ahead seems like the only possible way of escape.

Your body twitches as the high-pitch Russian folk music fills your two-dimensional senses, driving you mad.

What will you do?

—description from the introduction

Help! I'm a Tetra Block! was developed as an entry into the Pamphlet Dungeon Jam contest.  The game is presented as a six-pane, tri-fold, print-and-play brochure.

The game is a simple adaptation of Tetris (1984) into a paper-and-pencil, tabletop game.  Players alternate rolling a die to determine their piece configuration, and then placing that piece on the board.  Points are scored when blocks are played so they touch the top row of the playing grid.  If a line is sealed off with a gap, it is crossed off from play.  Play continues until no more legal moves are possible, at which point the player with the most points wins.

—user summary

Name: Ascension: Skulls and Sails – Honorless Thief Promo Card
Description:
This card is available with pre-orders of Ascension: Skull and Sails on the official website.

Name: Honorless Thief
Cost: 2 Runes
Type: Void Hero
Text: Gain 3 power and put this into the discard pile of a player with the least honor.
Flavor Text: A pirate's life for me.
Value: 0 Honor

Name: ハイテンション利休 (High-Tension Rikyu)
Humpalump
Description:
Humphrey the Humpalump has lost his legs. To help him find his legs, players have to roll the ball along his back.  If they all lands on an empty slot you can add one of your legs.  The first player to get all their legs on Humphrey wins the game.  Humpalump, the fast fun game for all ages!

—user summary

Name: Naniwa no Bob Jiten (なにわのボブジテン)
